definitions: items worn on the body for protection, decoration, or modesty
business sector focused on designing, producing, and selling garments
examples: She donated her old clothing to the charity drive
Winter clothing protects against cold weather and harsh winds
The clothing industry employs millions of workers worldwide
Fashion Week showcases new clothing collections from famous designers

definitions: formation of solid masses from liquid blood to stop bleeding
examples: Vitamin K plays an essential role in blood clotting
The patient's clotting time was tested before surgery
Clotting disorders can lead to excessive bleeding or thrombosis
Researchers studied the clotting cascade in hemophilia patients

definitions: visible collection of water droplets or ice crystals suspended in atmosphere
remote data storage and computing services accessed through the internet
any collection of particles or matter that obscures visibility
examples: Dark clouds gathered before the thunderstorm arrived
Cumulus clouds drifted across the bright blue sky
Companies migrate their data to cloud storage systems
Cloud computing reduces infrastructure costs for small businesses
A cloud of dust rose from the construction site
Smoke clouds billowed from the factory chimney

definitions: political, social, or economic power to influence decisions or events
forceful strike or hit with hand or heavy object
examples: The senator wielded considerable clout in Washington politics
Her financial clout helped secure the business deal
He delivered a powerful clout to the punching bag
The boxer took a clout to the jaw

definitions: dried flower bud of tropical tree used as aromatic spice
individual segment of a garlic bulb that can be separated
examples: Add three cloves to the mulled wine recipe
Ground cloves enhance the flavor of pumpkin pie
Mince two cloves of garlic for the pasta sauce
Each garlic bulb contains multiple individual cloves

definitions: small plant with trifoliate leaves commonly found in grasslands and lawns
examples: Four-leaf clovers are considered symbols of good luck
Bees collect nectar from white clover blossoms
Farmers plant clover to improve soil nitrogen levels
The rabbit nibbled on fresh clover in the meadow

definitions: road junction with loop ramps arranged in pattern resembling a four-leaf clover
examples: The cloverleaf interchange connects two major highways efficiently
Traffic flows smoothly through the newly constructed cloverleaf
Engineers designed a cloverleaf to reduce congestion at intersections
Aerial photos show the distinctive cloverleaf pattern clearly

definitions: entertainer who wears makeup and costume to perform comedy acts
person who behaves foolishly or acts in a silly manner
examples: The circus clown juggled colorful balls for children
Birthday party clowns create balloon animals for entertainment
Stop acting like a clown during the meeting
He's the class clown who always makes jokes

definitions: act of performing as a clown or behaving in a silly, humorous manner
examples: Professional clowning requires training in physical comedy techniques
His constant clowning disrupted the serious classroom atmosphere
She studied clowning at the theatrical arts academy
The children enjoyed the clowning at the birthday party

definitions: organized group of people with shared interests meeting regularly
heavy stick used as weapon or sporting equipment
one of four suits in standard deck marked with trefoil symbol
entertainment venue for dancing and socializing, typically open at night
examples: She joined the chess club at her university
The book club meets every Thursday evening
The caveman carried a wooden club for protection
Golf clubs are designed for different shot distances
He held three clubs and two diamonds in his hand
The ace of clubs won the final trick
The dance club stayed open until four in morning
They waited in line to enter the exclusive club

definitions: activity of going to nightclubs for dancing and entertainment
act of hitting repeatedly with a club or heavy object
examples: They went clubbing every Saturday night in downtown
Clubbing culture emerged strongly in the 1990s dance scene
The seal clubbing practice sparked international wildlife protests
Historical accounts describe clubbing as a primitive hunting method

definitions: building at sports venue containing locker rooms and team facilities
building used as headquarters or meeting place for club members
examples: Players celebrated their victory in the team clubhouse
The golf clubhouse offers dining and locker facilities
Children built a secret clubhouse in the backyard
Members gathered at the clubhouse for monthly meetings

definitions: piece of evidence or information that helps solve a mystery or problem
examples: Detectives found an important clue at the crime scene
The crossword clue was particularly challenging to solve
She had no clue about the surprise birthday party
Ancient artifacts provide clues about past civilizations

definitions: compact group or cluster of things growing or held together
dull heavy sound made by footsteps or falling objects
examples: A clump of trees stood in the middle field
She pulled out clumps of grass while weeding
Heavy boots made a clump on the wooden stairs
The clump of footsteps echoed in the hallway

definitions: group of similar things positioned or occurring closely together
examples: A cluster of stars formed the constellation pattern
Gene clusters control related biological functions together
The cluster of grapes hung heavy on the vine
Data points formed distinct clusters in the analysis

definitions: act or process of forming groups based on similarity or proximity
examples: Clustering algorithms organize data into meaningful groups automatically
Social clustering occurs naturally in urban neighborhoods
The clustering of symptoms helped diagnose the rare disease
Market clustering analysis revealed consumer behavior patterns

definitions: mechanical device in vehicles that engages and disengages power transmission
firm grip or grasp with hand or claws
crucial or critical moment requiring peak performance
group of eggs laid by bird at one time
examples: Press the clutch pedal before shifting gears smoothly
The clutch needs replacement after 80,000 miles
She maintained a clutch on her purse in crowds
The eagle's clutch held the fish firmly
He made the shot in the clutch moment
She always performs well in clutch situations
The hen sat on her clutch of twelve eggs
Scientists monitored the turtle's clutch size yearly

definitions: collection of things lying about in an untidy or disorganized state
examples: Desktop clutter makes it hard to find important documents
She decided to clear the clutter from her closet
Mental clutter can reduce productivity and increase stress levels
The garage accumulated years of clutter and junk

definitions: person who trains and instructs players in sport fundamentals and strategies
large motor vehicle for transporting passengers on long journeys
person who teaches or helps someone improve in specific area
examples: The basketball coach developed new offensive strategies daily
Our coach motivated the team during halftime speech
The tour coach departed from the hotel at dawn
Luxury coaches provide comfortable long-distance travel options
She hired a life coach to achieve personal goals
The voice coach improved her singing technique significantly

definitions: process of training, instructing, and mentoring individuals or teams for improvement
examples: Professional coaching helped improve her leadership skills tremendously
The team's coaching staff includes offensive and defensive coordinators
Executive coaching programs develop high-potential corporate leaders effectively
One-on-one coaching sessions address specific performance issues

definitions: person who drives a horse-drawn coach or carriage professionally
examples: The coachman guided the horses through narrow city streets
Victorian coachmen wore distinctive uniforms and top hats
The palace coachman prepared the royal carriage for ceremonies
Historical novels often feature coachmen as important characters

definitions: process by which liquid changes to semi-solid or solid state, especially blood clotting
examples: Blood coagulation prevents excessive bleeding from wound sites
Coagulation factors work in cascade to form stable clots
Milk coagulation is essential in cheese production processes
Chemical coagulation removes particles from water treatment systems

definitions: black or brown combustible sedimentary rock formed from ancient plant matter
examples: Coal powered the industrial revolution's steam engines worldwide
Miners extracted coal from deep underground seams daily
Coal burning releases carbon dioxide into Earth's atmosphere
Many countries phase out coal for renewable energy

definitions: process of coming together to form one mass or whole from separate parts
examples: The coalescence of water droplets forms larger raindrops
Political coalescence created a powerful unified opposition party
Bubble coalescence affects foam stability in industrial processes
Cultural coalescence occurs when diverse communities integrate together

definitions: geographical area containing significant coal deposits suitable for mining extraction
examples: The Yorkshire coalfield employed thousands of miners historically
New coalfields were discovered through geological survey mapping
Abandoned coalfields undergo environmental restoration and redevelopment projects
The coalfield stretched across three neighboring counties

definitions: temporary alliance of distinct parties, persons, or states for joint action
examples: The coalition government included three different political parties
Environmental groups formed a coalition against deforestation
Military coalitions coordinate international peacekeeping operations effectively
The coalition collapsed when key members withdrew support

definitions: land near or adjoining the sea or ocean shoreline
examples: Tourists flock to the Mediterranean coast every summer
The rugged coast features dramatic cliffs and beaches
Coastal erosion threatens many communities along the eastern coast
Marine life thrives along the rocky Pacific coast

definitions: small mat placed under drinking glass to protect surface
ship that sails along coast carrying cargo between ports
wheeled car that travels on roller coaster track
examples: Place your glass on a coaster to protect the table
She collected decorative coasters from different countries
The coaster transported goods between regional ports efficiently
Small coasters navigate shallow coastal waters easily
The coaster climbed slowly before the thrilling descent
Each coaster car holds four passengers securely

definitions: organization responsible for maritime safety, security, and rescue operations at sea
examples: The coastguard rescued sailors from the sinking vessel
Coastguard helicopters patrol territorial waters for emergencies
She joined the coastguard after completing maritime training
The coastguard intercepted drug smugglers near the border

definitions: outline or shape of a coast as seen from sea or on map
examples: The jagged coastline extends for hundreds of miles northward

Satellites map coastline changes from erosion and deposition
The coastline offers spectacular views and hiking trails

definitions: outer garment worn outdoors over other clothes for warmth or protection
layer of substance covering a surface for protection or decoration
examples: She wore a wool coat against the winter cold
His coat hung on the rack by the door
Apply a second coat of paint after drying completely
The dog's coat shone after regular grooming

definitions: thin layer or covering of substance applied to surface for protection or enhancement
examples: The non-stick coating prevents food from burning easily
Protective coating shields metal from rust and corrosion
Sugar coating makes bitter medicine easier to swallow
The lens coating reduces glare and improves visibility

definitions: person who writes a book, article, or document jointly with another author
examples: She served as coauthor on three scientific research papers
The coauthors collaborated remotely using shared documents
Finding a compatible coauthor enhanced the book's perspective
Each coauthor contributed unique expertise to the project

definitions: central core of corn ear where kernels attach
adult male swan distinguished from female pen
short-legged, sturdy horse breed traditionally used for riding
building material made from clay, straw, and water mixture
examples: Remove kernels from the cob for the corn salad
Grilled corn on the cob tastes best with butter
The cob protected his mate aggressively during nesting season
A cob swan can be identified by larger size
The cob horse pulled the cart steadily uphill
Welsh cobs are known for their gentle temperament
Traditional cob houses stay cool in summer naturally
The cob walls were built using local materials

definitions: hard silvery-white magnetic metallic element used in alloys and batteries
deep blue color pigment derived from cobalt compounds
examples: Cobalt strengthens steel alloys for high-temperature applications
Lithium cobalt batteries power many electronic devices
Artists prize cobalt blue for its vibrant permanent color
The vase displayed beautiful cobalt blue decorative patterns

definitions: naturally rounded stone used for paving streets or paths
examples: Old cobbles lined the historic downtown streets beautifully
Workers laid cobbles in decorative garden pathway patterns
The cobbles made walking difficult in high heels
Rain made the cobbles slippery and dangerous

definitions: person who repairs shoes and other leather goods professionally
baked dessert of fruit topped with thick biscuit or cake crust
examples: The cobbler replaced worn heels on her favorite boots
Local cobblers provide essential shoe repair services
Peach cobbler served warm makes a perfect summer dessert
Grandma's apple cobbler recipe won the county fair

definitions: naturally rounded stone used in paving roads, streets, or walkways
examples: Historic cobblestone streets preserve the neighborhood's character beautifully
Horse carriages clattered over the wet cobblestone roads
Each cobblestone was carefully placed by skilled craftsmen
The cobblestone plaza dates back three hundred years

definitions: highly venomous snake that spreads its neck ribs to form hood when threatened
examples: The king cobra is the world's longest venomous snake
A cobra's hood display warns potential predators away
Snake charmers traditionally use cobras in their performances
Cobra venom contains powerful neurotoxins affecting nervous systems

definitions: web spun by spider from silk thread to catch prey
examples: Morning dew made the cobwebs visible in the garden
She brushed cobwebs from the abandoned attic corners
Cobwebs covered the old furniture in the basement
The intricate cobweb glistened in the morning sunlight

definitions: South American shrub whose leaves contain cocaine alkaloid and are traditionally chewed
examples: Indigenous peoples chewed coca leaves for energy and altitude sickness
Coca cultivation remains controversial in Andean countries
The coca plant grows naturally in mountainous regions
Traditional coca tea helps visitors adjust to high altitude

definitions: powerful stimulant drug derived from coca leaves, used illegally as recreational narcotic
examples: Cocaine addiction devastates lives and families across communities
Police seized large quantities of cocaine at the border
Medical use of cocaine as local anesthetic is rare
The cocaine trade fuels violence in many regions

definitions: adult male bird, especially domestic fowl or rooster
valve or tap controlling flow of liquid or gas
hammer of firearm that strikes firing pin
examples: The cock crowed at dawn every morning reliably
A fighting cock defended his territory aggressively
Turn the cock to stop water flow completely
The fuel cock controls gas flow to engine
He pulled back the cock before firing the pistol
The cock mechanism needed careful maintenance

definitions: large parrot with erectile crest native to Australia and nearby regions
examples: The white cockatoo raised its yellow crest dramatically

Pet cockatoos require extensive care and social interaction

definitions: young male domestic fowl less than one year old
examples: The cockerel practiced crowing in the early morning

Farmers separate cockerels from pullets after hatching
The cockerel's plumage developed vibrant colors gradually

definitions: illegal blood sport where two roosters fight until injury or death
examples: Cockfighting remains illegal in most developed countries worldwide

Animal rights groups campaign against cockfighting practices globally

definitions: small edible saltwater clam with ribbed heart-shaped shell
examples: Fresh cockles are popular in Welsh seafood dishes

definitions: native of East London or person speaking its distinctive dialect and accent
examples: His cockney accent revealed his East London origins

Traditional cockney culture centers around market life
The cockney dialect includes unique vocabulary and pronunciation

definitions: compartment where pilot controls aircraft or spacecraft
pit or enclosed area for cockfights or contests
examples: Pilots checked instruments in the cockpit before takeoff
The cockpit door remained locked during commercial flights
The old cockpit hosted illegal fights decades ago
Roman cockpits were excavated by archaeologists recently

definitions: flat-bodied fast-moving insect that infests buildings and spreads disease
examples: Cockroaches survived in the apartment despite repeated treatments
A cockroach scurried across the kitchen floor quickly
Professional exterminators eliminated the cockroach infestation completely
Cockroaches can survive extreme conditions including radiation
